data.title: Her Imperial Highnesses Princess Mikasa and her family
data.text:
Her Imperial Highness Princess Mikasa

Name

Yuriko

Lineage

Second Daughter of the late Masanari Takagi

Date of Birth

4 June 1923

Honorary Positions

Reserve Member of the Imperial House Council

Honorary Vice-President of the Japanese Red Cross Society

Education

1941 - Graduated from the Gakushuin Women's Academy

Marriage

Imperial Consent

29 March 1941

Engagement Ceremony (Nosai no Gi)

3 October 1941

Marriage

22 October 1941

Children

First Daughter

Her Imperial Highness Princess Yasuko

Date of Birth: 26 April 1944

Marriage: 18 December 1966 (Mrs. Tadateru Konoe)

First Son

His Imperial Highness Prince Tomohito

Date of Birth: 5 January 1946

Marriage: 7 November 1980

Decease: 6 June 2012

Second Son

His Imperial Highness Prince Katsura (Yoshihito)

Date of Birth: 11 February 1948

Decease: 8 June 2014

Second Daughter

Her Imperial Highness Princess Masako

Date of Birth: 23 October 1951

Marriage: 14 October 1983 (Mrs. Soshitsu Sen)

Third Son

His Imperial Highness Prince Takamado (Norihito)

Date of Birth: 29 December 1954

Marriage: 6 December 1984

Decease: 21 November 2002

Her Imperial Highness Princess Tomohito of Mikasa

Name

Nobuko

Lineage

Third Daughter of the late Takakichi Aso

Date of Birth

9 April 1955

Honorary Positions

President of the Tokyo Jikeikai

Honorary President of the Japan Rose Society

Honorary President of The Doyo Society of JAPAN

Honorary President of the Japan Building Maintenance Association

Honorary President of the Womenâs Healthcare Awareness & Menopause Network Society

Honorary Vice-President of the Japanese Red Cross Society

International Judo Federation Ambassador

Education

1973 - Graduated from Rosslyn House College, UK

Marriage

Imperial House Council

18 April 1980

Engagement Ceremony (Nosai no Gi)

21 May 1980

Marriage

7 November 1980

Children

Elder Daughter

Her Imperial Highness Princess Akiko

Date of Birth : 20 December 1981

2004 - 2010 Studied abroadat at Merton College, the University of Oxford in the UK.

2010 - D. Phil. from the University of Oxford in the UK.

2018 - Honorary Doctor of Letters from the Kokushikan University.

President of Shinyusha, General Incorporated Association.

Honorary Patron of the Japan-British Society.

President of the Japan-Turkey Society.

President of the Professional Ski Instructors Association of Japan.

President of the Middle Eastern Culture Center in Japan.

President of the Prince Mikasa Foundation

President of Ichimura Foundation for New Technology

Honorary Patron of Japan Rugby Football Union

Honorary President of the Classics Day Prize Committee

Honorary Chairman of Kokka Seiwakai

Professor, Institute of Japanese Culture, Kyoto Sangyo University.

Guest Professor, Kyoto City University of Arts.

Guest Research Fellow, Archival Research Center, Kyoto City University of Arts.

Visiting Professor, Ritsumeikan University.

Special Guest Professor, Kokugakuin University

Visiting Professor, Kokushikan University Graduate School of Human Sciences.

Professor, Chiba Institute of Technology

Principal Staff Scientist, Institute for Geo-Cosmology, Chiba Institute of Technology

Second Daughter

Her Imperial Highness Princess Yohko

Date of Birth : 25 October 1983

Graduated from the Gakushuin Women's College

She had worked at the Japanese Red Cross Society since December 2006 to November 2012.

President of the Social Welfare Organization "Yuaijujikai"

Honorary President of the Japan Universal Sound Design Association

Honorary Advisor of the Inclusive Design Network

His Imperial Highness Prince Mikasa

Name

Takahito

Lineage

Fourth Son of Emperor Taisho

Date of Birth

2 December 1915

The Personal Title for Young Members(Been conferred in accordance with the Imperial Family's tradition of appellation)

Prince Sumi(Sumi-no-Miya)

Coming of Age Ceremony

2 December 1935 (at the age of 20)

Deceased

27 October 2016

Education

After studying at the Gakushuin Junior High School graduated from the Military Academy and served in the cavalry regiment.

1941 - Graduated from the Military Staff College and served as a staff officer
